full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 105 of 197 2646 LCHCmax3 Dubin - direct 1 A. I don't really recall exactly what I saw. I saw my name and flights. 2 Q. Do you recall when you saw these in the media? 3 A. I can't recall. 4 Q. When you read what you believed to be flight records in the media, did anything strike you as being inaccurate in what was being published from your memory? 5 MS. MOE: Same objection, your Honor. 6 THE COURT: I'll permit response to this question. So when you read what you believed to be flight records in the media, did anything strike you as being inaccurate? 7 A. I saw that the media had copied the flight book incorrectly. 8 Q. Okay. What did you believe was incorrect in what the media had copied incorrectly? 9 MS. MOE: Your Honor, we'd object. There is evidence in the record that he can ask the witness about. I'm not sure what we're talking about even at this point. 10 MR. PAGLIUCA: I can discuss this at sidebar if you want, your Honor. I think it's relevant. 11 THE COURT: We'll give the jury their morning break and we'll discuss it. 12 Members of the jury, we'll take a 15-minute break. 13 (Continued on next page) 14 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00016834
